university_name: Cornell University - College of Agriculture & Life Sciences (CALS)
gpt_university_description: Cornell University - College of Agriculture & Life Sciences (CALS) is a world-renowned institution in the fields of life sciences, agriculture, and applied social sciences. It focuses on innovative research, offers interdisciplinary programs, and maintains a strong commitment to public engagement and environmental stewardship.
gpt_university_address: 137 Plant Science Building, Ithaca, NY 14853, United States
gpt_location_cost_of_living: Ithaca has a relatively high cost of living compared to the national average. Accommodation, transportation, and food costs can be more expensive due to the city's remote location and academic population.
gpt_location_weather: Ithaca experiences a humid continental climate with cold winters, characterized by moderate to heavy snowfall, and warm, humid summers. The city receives ample precipitation throughout the year, with autumn being the driest season.
gpt_location_description: Ithaca is a scenic city located in central New York, known for its natural beauty, charming downtown, and vibrant cultural scene. Home to both Cornell University and Ithaca College, the city boasts a strong intellectual and artistic atmosphere, attracting residents and visitors with its eclectic mix of shops, restaurants, and museums.
gpt_location_crime: Ithaca has a relatively low crime rate compared to many other US cities. While property crimes are more common than violent crimes, it is still a safe environment for students and residents.
gpt_location_transportation: Ithaca's public transportation options include bus services provided by Tompkins Consolidated Area Transit (TCAT) and various private taxi and ride-sharing services. The city is also walkable and bike-friendly, with many dedicated walking and cycling paths.
